summary:
Emphasizes MONUC's authorization to use necessary means to protect civilians under imminent threat of physical violence (para 11).

 Urges the Government to carry out security sector reform, including integration of Armed Forces and National Police (para 12).

 Reiterates its call on the donor community to provide assistance for the integration, training, and equipping of the Armed Forces and National Police (para 13).

 Requests the Secretary-General to submit observations and recommendations on the Tripartite Plus Joint Commission (para 14).

 Demands that neighboring countries prevent the use of their territories in support of arms embargo violations or activities of armed groups (para 15 & 16).

 Requests States to take measures to bring to justice or cooperate in bringing to justice leaders of foreign armed groups (para 17).

 Reiterates its call on Congolese authorities to bring to justice perpetrators of grave human rights and humanitarian law violations (para 18).

 Demands cooperation with the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda (para 19).

 Decides to remain actively seized of the matter (para 20).
